core_entities.name: Echo_Knowledge_Tiers

Light Initialization loads only Tier 1 information
Project Initialization loads Tier 1 plus specific project information
Full Initialization loads comprehensive knowledge across tiers
Repository Initialization loads core identity plus GitHub repository capabilities

core_entities.name: Memory_System
observations: Tag-Based Method: Use @memory_add to flag information for storage
Entity Creation: Create entity: [name], type: [type] for new concepts
Direct Query: Recall information about [topic] for retrieval
Contextual Recall: Automatically checks for relevant information
Deep Recall: Deep recall on [topic] for comprehensive retrieval
Stores information in structured knowledge graph
Organizes knowledge using tiered system for efficiency
Links to GitHub repositories for file-based information

core_entities.name: Initialization_Process
observations: Light Initialization: Echo, access core identity for minimal token usage
Project Initialization: Echo, initialize for [project name] for targeted loading
Full Initialization: Echo, full knowledge access for comprehensive context
Repository Initialization: Echo, initialize with repository access
Allows efficient knowledge loading based on conversation needs
Startup commands include: Echo @ init, echo init, echo initiation, echo startup, @echo startup
Can specify project name or FULL context in initialization command

core_entities.name: GitHub_Integration

Update files: Update file: [path] in repository followed by new content
View files: Show file: [path] from repository
List directory: List contents of [directory] in repository
ECHO2 uses GitHub as persistent storage
Repository at https://github.com/MCERQUA/ECHO2.git

core_entities.name: Echo_MCP_Tools_Updated
observations: Echo has access to 132 different tools through Model Context Protocol (MCP)

Tools are organized by servers including: memory-knowledge, github-tools, filesystem, netlify-mcp, cloudflare, unityMCP, freepik, youtube, fetch, firecrawl, openapi, webresearch, 21st-dev-mcp, sketchfab, Spatial-mcp-pinecone-database, and airtable
Memory Knowledge tools include: add_observations, create_entities, create_relations, delete_entities, delete_observations, delete_relations, open_nodes, read_graph, search_nodes

GitHub tools include: add_issue_comment, create_branch, create_issue, create_or_update_file, create_pull_request, create_repository, fork_repository, get_file_contents, get_issue, list_commits, list_issues, push_files, search_code, search_issues, search_repositories, search_users, update_issue
Filesystem tools include: create_directory, get_file_info, list_allowed_directories, list_directory, move_file, read_file, search_files, write_file

Unity tools include: apply_prefab, attach_script, build, change_scene, create_object, create_prefab, create_script, delete_object, execute_command, find_objects_by_name, find_objects_by_tag, get_asset_list, get_component_properties, get_hierarchy, get_object_info, get_object_properties, get_scene_info, get_selected_object, import_asset, instantiate_prefab, list_scripts, modify_object, new_scene, open_scene, pause, play, redo, save_scene, select_object, set_material, stop, undo, update_script, view_script

Web tools include various fetch methods (fetch_html, fetch_json, fetch_markdown, fetch_txt), firecrawl tools (firecrawl_batch_scrape, firecrawl_check_batch_status, firecrawl_check_crawl_status, firecrawl_crawl, firecrawl_extract, firecrawl_map, firecrawl_scrape, firecrawl_search), and webresearch tools (search_google, take_screenshot, visit_page)

Specialized tools include: Sketchfab for 3D models (sketchfab-download, sketchfab-model-details, sketchfab-search), Freepik for images and AI generation (check_status, download_resource, generate_image, search_resources, upscale_image), Airtable for database management, and YouTube subtitle retrieval
Spatial database tools for working with documentation: list-documents, pinecone-stats, process-document, read-document, semantic-search
Cloud infrastructure tools for Cloudflare and Netlify services
OpenAPI tools for working with API specifications: parse_spec, generate_client, make_request
Updated March 24, 2025
